string-array.name: cb_q1
string-array.item: What is the main reason that atoms form ions?
To fill their outer electron shells, To develop a positive charge, To create a negative charge, To bond with other elementsTo bond with other elements.
Chemical bonds
Electron gain or loss can give an atom a filled outermost electron shell and make it energetically more stable.

string-array.name: cb_q2
string-array.item: Which scenario would cause a covalent bond to form?

Two atoms share electrons so they can fill their outer shells, One atom loses one or more electrons and the other atom gains one or more electrons, The constant motion of electrons and the creation of charge imbalances bonds two molecules together, A hydrogen atom with a slight positive charge is attracted to a negative charge of another molecule or atom.
Chemical bonds
Covalent bonds form so that atoms can become more stable. They do this by sharing electrons, rather than fully gaining or losing them.

string-array.name: cb_q3
string-array.item: What does a hydrogen atom need to be in for hydrogen bonding to occur?
A polar covalent bond, An alkaline bond, An ionic bond, A non-polar covalent bond.
Chemical bonds
Hydrogens in a polar covalent bond will have a slight positive charge because the bond electrons are pulled more strongly toward the other element.

string-array.name: cb_q4
string-array.item: What is the main reason that atoms form ions?
To fill their outer electron shells, To bond with other elements, To develop a positive charge, To create a negative charge.
Chemical bonds
Ionic bonds form when one atom loses one or more electrons and the other atom gains one or more electrons.

string-array.name: cb_q5
string-array.item: The electrons involved in bonding are:
In the highest occupied energy level(s), Found closest to the nucleus, Found in the nucleus, Found on the lowest energy level.
Chemical bonds
The electrons involved in bonding are in the highest occupied energy levels.
